channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Dense Interspecies Face Embedding
item.description: There are three main obstacles for interspecies face understanding: (1) lack of animal data compared to human, (2) ambiguous connection between faces of various animals, and (3) extreme shape and style variance.

item.title: TrustGAN: Training safe and trustworthy deep learning models through generative adversarial networks
item.description: These models are given real data, simulated data or combination of both and are trained to be highly predictive on them.

item.title: CAD2Render: A Modular Toolkit for GPU-accelerated Photorealistic Synthetic Data Generation for the Manufacturing Industry
item.description: The use of computer vision for product and assembly quality control is becoming ubiquitous in the manufacturing industry.

item.title: MorphPool: Efficient Non-linear Pooling & Unpooling in CNNs
item.description: Pooling is essentially an operation from the field of Mathematical Morphology, with max pooling as a limited special case.

item.title: Positive unlabeled learning with tensor networks
item.description: Positive unlabeled learning is a binary classification problem with positive and unlabeled data.

item.title: MUSIED: A Benchmark for Event Detection from Multi-Source Heterogeneous Informal Texts
item.description: As a pioneering exploration that expands event detection to the scenarios involving informal and heterogeneous texts, we propose a new large-scale Chinese event detection dataset based on user reviews, text conversations, and phone conversations in a leading e-commerce platform for food service.

item.title: PoET: Pose Estimation Transformer for Single-View, Multi-Object 6D Pose Estimation
item.description: It is a challenging task due to object symmetries, clutter and occlusion, but it becomes more challenging when additional information, such as depth and 3D models, is not provided.

item.title: Fuzzy clustering for the within-season estimation of cotton phenology
item.description: In this work, we propose a new approach for the within-season phenology estimation for cotton at the field level.

item.title: Open-Source Skull Reconstruction with MONAI
item.description: The primary goal of this paper lies in the investigation of open-sourcing codes and pre-trained deep learning models under the MONAI framework.

item.title: FFHQ-UV: Normalized Facial UV-Texture Dataset for 3D Face Reconstruction
item.description: Our pipeline utilizes the recent advances in StyleGAN-based facial image editing approaches to generate multi-view normalized face images from single-image inputs.

item.title: Towards Good Practices for Missing Modality Robust Action Recognition
item.description: We ask: how can we train a model that is robust to missing modalities?

item.title: Language-Assisted 3D Feature Learning for Semantic Scene Understanding
item.description: To guide 3D feature learning toward important geometric attributes and scene context, we explore the help of textual scene descriptions.

item.title: Cross-Domain Ensemble Distillation for Domain Generalization
item.description: Domain generalization is the task of learning models that generalize to unseen target domains.

item.title: MAEDAY: MAE for few and zero shot AnomalY-Detection
item.description: We show that MAEDAY performs surprisingly well at this task.

item.title: PIP: Positional-encoding Image Prior
item.description: In Deep Image Prior (DIP), a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) is fitted to map a latent space to a degraded (e. g. noisy) image but in the process learns to reconstruct the clean image.

item.title: DATE: Dual Assignment for End-to-End Fully Convolutional Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we revisit these two assignment methods and find that bringing one-to-many assignment back to end-to-end fully convolutional detectors helps with model convergence.

item.title: Multiverse: Multilingual Evidence for Fake News Detection
item.description: In this work, we propose Multiverse -- a new feature based on multilingual evidence that can be used for fake news detection and improve existing approaches.

item.title: Assistive Teaching of Motor Control Tasks to Humans
item.description: In this paper, we focus on the problem of assistive teaching of motor control tasks such as parking a car or landing an aircraft.

item.title: Competency-Aware Neural Machine Translation: Can Machine Translation Know its Own Translation Quality?
item.description: The lack of competency awareness makes NMT untrustworthy.

item.title: SCOOP: Self-Supervised Correspondence and Optimization-Based Scene Flow
item.description: Scene flow estimation is a long-standing problem in computer vision, where the goal is to find the 3D motion of a scene from its consecutive observations.

item.title: Beyond Smoothing: Unsupervised Graph Representation Learning with Edge Heterophily Discriminating
item.description: Node representations are learned through contrasting the dual-channel encodings obtained from the discriminated homophilic and heterophilic edges.

item.title: Wild-Time: A Benchmark of in-the-Wild Distribution Shift over Time
item.description: Temporal shifts -- distribution shifts arising from the passage of time -- often occur gradually and have the additional structure of timestamp metadata.

item.title: Learning General Audio Representations with Large-Scale Training of Patchout Audio Transformers
item.description: Furthermore, we will show that transformers trained on Audioset can be extremely effective representation extractors for a wide range of downstream tasks.

item.title: Copy-Pasting Coherent Depth Regions Improves Contrastive Learning for Urban-Scene Segmentation
item.description: For unsupervised semantic segmentation of urban scenes, our method surpasses the previous state-of-the-art baseline by +7. 14% in mIoU on Cityscapes and +6. 65% on KITTI.

item.title: Spatial-Spectral Transformer for Hyperspectral Image Denoising
item.description: Hyperspectral image (HSI) denoising is a crucial preprocessing procedure for the subsequent HSI applications.

item.title: One-Shot General Object Localization
item.description: In contrast, our proposed OneLoc algorithm efficiently finds the object center and bounding box size by a special voting scheme.

item.title: Learning with Partial Labels from Semi-supervised Perspective
item.description: Inspired by the impressive success of deep Semi-Supervised (SS) learning, we transform the PL learning problem into the SS learning problem, and propose a novel PL learning method, namely Partial Label learning with Semi-supervised Perspective (PLSP).

item.title: CasFusionNet: A Cascaded Network for Point Cloud Semantic Scene Completion by Dense Feature Fusion
item.description: In our work, we present CasFusionNet, a novel cascaded network for point cloud semantic scene completion by dense feature fusion.

item.title: Lifting Weak Supervision To Structured Prediction
item.description: Weak supervision (WS) is a rich set of techniques that produce pseudolabels by aggregating easily obtained but potentially noisy label estimates from a variety of sources.

item.title: Explainable and Safe Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Air Mobility
item.description: Although DRL has achieved important advancements in this field, the existing works pay little attention to the explainability and safety issues related to DRL controllers, particularly the safety under adversarial attacks.

item.title: GAN Prior based Null-Space Learning for Consistent Super-Resolution
item.description: Consistency and realness have always been the two critical issues of image super-resolution.

item.title: Deep Demosaicing for Polarimetric Filter Array Cameras
item.description: Polarisation Filter Array (PFA) cameras allow the analysis of light polarisation state in a simple and cost-effective manner.

item.title: Neural Weight Search for Scalable Task Incremental Learning
item.description: Task incremental learning aims to enable a system to maintain its performance on previously learned tasks while learning new tasks, solving the problem of catastrophic forgetting.

item.title: NQE: N-ary Query Embedding for Complex Query Answering over Hyper-relational Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Complex query answering (CQA) is an essential task for multi-hop and logical reasoning on knowledge graphs (KGs).

item.title: Towards Practical Control of Singular Values of Convolutional Layers
item.description: We demonstrate the improved properties of modern CNNs with our method and analyze its impact on the model performance, calibration, and adversarial robustness.

item.title: A Benchmark of Long-tailed Instance Segmentation with Noisy Labels (Short Version)
item.description: In this paper, we consider the instance segmentation task on a long-tailed dataset, which contains label noise, i. e., some of the annotations are incorrect.

item.title: The GA-cal software for the automatic calibration of soil constitutive laws: a tutorial and a user manual
item.description: The calibration of an advanced constitutive law for soil is a challenging task.

item.title: Object Detection in Foggy Scenes by Embedding Depth and Reconstruction into Domain Adaptation
item.description: In our DA framework, we retain the depth and background information during the domain feature alignment.

item.title: Reduction Algorithms for Persistence Diagrams of Networks: CoralTDA and PrunIT
item.description: Second, we introduce a pruning algorithm for graphs to compute their persistence diagrams by removing the dominated vertices.

item.title: Real-Time Physics-Based Object Pose Tracking during Non-Prehensile Manipulation
item.description: At any given time during the manipulation of the object, we assume access to the robot joint controls and an image from a camera looking at the scene.

item.title: Immersive Neural Graphics Primitives
item.description: In this paper, we present and evaluate a NeRF-based framework that is capable of rendering scenes in immersive VR allowing users to freely move their heads to explore complex real-world scenes.

item.title: Perception-Oriented Single Image Super-Resolution using Optimal Objective Estimation
item.description: The generative model is trained over our proposed objective trajectory representing a set of essential objectives, which enables the single network to learn various SR results corresponding to combined losses on the trajectory.

item.title: Knowledge-Aware Federated Active Learning with Non-IID Data
item.description: In this paper, we propose a federated active learning paradigm to efficiently learn a global model with limited annotation budget while protecting data privacy in a decentralized learning way.

item.title: Learning to Take a Break: Sustainable Optimization of Long-Term User Engagement
item.description: Optimizing user engagement is a key goal for modern recommendation systems, but blindly pushing users towards increased consumption risks burn-out, churn, or even addictive habits.

item.title: PyTAIL: Interactive and Incremental Learning of NLP Models with Human in the Loop for Online Data
item.description: For natural language processing (NLP) tasks that utilize a collection of features based on lexicons and rules, it is important to adapt these features to the changing data.

item.title: Multi-Task Learning of Object State Changes from Uncurated Videos
item.description: We aim to learn to temporally localize object state changes and the corresponding state-modifying actions by observing people interacting with objects in long uncurated web videos.

item.title: PAC-Bayes Compression Bounds So Tight That They Can Explain Generalization
item.description: While there has been progress in developing non-vacuous generalization bounds for deep neural networks, these bounds tend to be uninformative about why deep learning works.

item.title: Cross Aggregation Transformer for Image Restoration
item.description: The core of our CAT is the Rectangle-Window Self-Attention (Rwin-SA), which utilizes horizontal and vertical rectangle window attention in different heads parallelly to expand the attention area and aggregate the features cross different windows.

item.title: Go Beyond Point Pairs: A General and Accurate Sim2Real Object Pose Voting Method with Efficient Online Synthetic Training
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel method for sim-to-real pose estimation, which is effective on both instance-level and category-level settings.

item.title: More comprehensive facial inversion for more effective expression recognition
item.description: We extensively evaluate ASIT on facial datasets such as FFHQ and CelebA-HQ, showing that our approach achieves state-of-the-art facial inversion performance.
